docs.title: Task 1: Add max_context to Model Catalog + AI Settings Persistence
Allowed context sizes: powers-of-2 friendly stops from 2K to 128K
RAM estimates per context size (approximate, for UI display)
Based on Q4_K_M 8B model: ~5GB base + ~0.5GB per 8K context
Task 3: Context Window Truncation in API Routes (ask + chat/multi)
Task 4: Frontend — Context Window Slider in Settings
Task 5: Integration — Load Persisted AI Settings on Startup

docs.title: get_ai_settings :material-sync: async
docs.text:

docs.title: detect_available_devices
docs.text:
def detect_available_devices() -> list[str]

Detect available compute devices for transcription.

Detect available compute devices for transcription.

Returns devices based on available engines:
- cpu: Always available (WhisperX)
- cuda: Available if NVIDIA GPU + torch (WhisperX)
- mps: Available if Apple Silicon + mlx-whisper (MLX Whisper)

Result is cached.

Returns: list[str]

docs.title: detect_diarization_device
docs.text:
def detect_diarization_device() -> str

Detect the best device for pyannote diarization.

Detect the best device for pyannote diarization.

Pyannote supports cpu, cuda, and mps (Apple Silicon).
Returns the best available device.

Returns: str

docs.title: detect_whisperx_device
docs.text:
def detect_whisperx_device() -> str

Detect the best device for WhisperX transcription.

Detect the best device for WhisperX transcription.

WhisperX (ctranslate2) supports cpu and cuda only.
Uses CTranslate2's native CUDA detection (independent of PyTorch CUDA).
MPS is handled by engine auto-detect selecting mlx-whisper instead.

Returns: str

Getting Started --- This guide covers the prerequisites, installation, and project structure for **verbatim-studio**. --- ## Prerequisites - TypeScript development environment - Python development environment - Markdown development environment - JSON development environment - Shell development environment - YAML development environment - JavaScript development environment - TOML development environment --- ## Installation 
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/JongoDB/verbatim-studio
cd verbatim-studio

# Install dependencies
poetry install

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: Severity Count :material-alert-circle: Critical 0 :material-alert: Warning 5 :material-information: Info 1 Total 6

docs.title: Documentation
docs.text:
2141 undocumented exported symbols

Found 2141 exported symbols without JSDoc/docstring documentation across 193 files. Examples: Verbatim Studio - Claude Context File, Project Overview, Directory Structure, Version Files (ALL must be updated together), Release Workflow....

Affected files: CLAUDE_CONTEXT.md, README.md, apps/electron/electron-builder-update.yml, apps/electron/src/main/backend.ts, apps/electron/src/main/ipc.ts, apps/electron/src/main/screenshot.ts, apps/electron/src/main/splash.ts, apps/electron/src/main/update-script.ts, apps/electron/src/main/update-store.ts, apps/electron/src/main/windows.ts

Suggestion: Add JSDoc comments or docstrings to all exported symbols to improve API documentation quality.

docs.title: Code Quality
docs.text:
65 oversized modules

Found 65 modules exceeding 500 lines or 30 symbols. Largest: CLAUDE_CONTEXT.md (316 lines, 62 symbols).

Affected files: CLAUDE_CONTEXT.md, README.md, apps/electron/package-lock.json, apps/electron/src/main/updater.ts, docs/DEPENDENCIES.md, docs/VERBATIM_STUDIO_SPEC_v2.md, docs/architecture/plugin-system-design.md, docs/llm-context.md, docs/plans/2025-01-17-phase1-foundation.md, docs/plans/2025-01-17-phase2-core-transcription.md

Suggestion: Consider splitting large modules into smaller, focused files with single responsibility.

278 orphan modules (potential dead code)

Found 278 modules with no imports or exports in the dependency graph. These may be unused dead code.

Affected files: CLAUDE_CONTEXT.md, README.md, apps/electron/electron-builder-update.yml, apps/electron/package-lock.json, apps/electron/package.json, apps/electron/tsconfig.json, apps/electron/tsconfig.preload.json, docs/DEPENDENCIES.md, docs/ROADMAP.md, docs/VERBATIM_FEATURE_MATRIX.md

Suggestion: Review orphan modules — remove if unused, or add explicit imports/exports if they are needed.

48 symbols with missing or any types

Found 48 exported functions with any types or missing return types. Examples: App, AudioLevelMeter, DownloadIndicator.

Affected files: packages/frontend/src/app/App.tsx, packages/frontend/src/components/audio/AudioLevelMeter.tsx, packages/frontend/src/components/downloads/DownloadIndicator.tsx, packages/frontend/src/components/onboarding/OnboardingTour.tsx, packages/frontend/src/components/onboarding/TourToast.tsx, packages/frontend/src/components/plugins/PluginSlot.tsx, packages/frontend/src/components/storage/OAuthConnectButton.tsx, packages/frontend/src/components/tasks/TaskIndicator.tsx, packages/frontend/src/components/updates/UpdatePrompt.tsx, packages/frontend/src/hooks/useConversations.ts

Suggestion: Add explicit type annotations to improve type safety and documentation quality.

Mixed naming conventions across exports

Exports use multiple naming conventions: PascalCase (676), camelCase (205), snake_case (136). The dominant convention is PascalCase.

Suggestion: Consider standardizing on PascalCase for consistency across the codebase.

docs.title: Architecture
docs.text:
103 deeply nested files

Found 103 files nested more than 5 directories deep. Deepest: packages/backend/adapters/database/sqlite/__init__.py (6 levels).

Affected files: packages/backend/adapters/database/sqlite/__init__.py, packages/backend/adapters/database/sqlite/adapter.py, packages/backend/adapters/database/sqlite/mappers.py, packages/backend/adapters/database/sqlite/repositories.py, packages/frontend/src/components/ai/AIAnalysisPanel.tsx, packages/frontend/src/components/ai/AttachmentPicker.tsx, packages/frontend/src/components/ai/ChatFAB.tsx, packages/frontend/src/components/ai/ChatHeader.tsx, packages/frontend/src/components/ai/ChatInput.tsx, packages/frontend/src/components/ai/ChatMessages.tsx

docs.title: resource-migration.ts
docs.text:
Migrates heavy resources (Python env, FFmpeg) from the app bundle to the

Migrates heavy resources (Python env, FFmpeg) from the app bundle to the user data directory on first launch. This allows stripped "update" releases to work without re-bundling the Python environment every time. Flow: Full install → Python in bundle → copied to user data on first launch Update install → No Python in bundle → user data copy already exists

async function migrateResourcesToUserData(
  onProgress?: (message: string) => void
): Promise<boolean>

:material-github: View source

Migrate bundled Python environment to user data directory.

Migrate bundled Python environment to user data directory. Skips if already migrated or if no bundled Python (update variant). Uses a temp directory + rename strategy for crash recovery: if the app crashes mid-copy, the temp dir is cleaned up on next launch.

Parameters:

Name Type Default Description onProgress? (message: string) => void

Returns: Promise<boolean> true if migration happened, false if skipped

function generateUpdaterScript(volumePath: string, appName: string): string

:material-github: View source

Generates a shell script for seamless macOS app replacement.

Generates a shell script for seamless macOS app replacement. The script: 1. Waits for the app to quit (with timeout) 2. Removes old app from /Applications 3. Copies new app from mounted DMG volume 4. Relaunches the app 5. Cleans up (unmounts DMG, removes temp files)

Parameters:

Name Type Default Description volumePath string appName string

Returns: string

docs.text:
def get_llama_service(

:material-github: View source

Get a cached LlamaCppAIService, creating or replacing as needed.

Get a cached LlamaCppAIService, creating or replacing as needed.

If the model_path differs from the cached service's path, the cache
is invalidated and a new service is created. This allows model switching
without restarting the server.

Args:
    model_path: Path to the GGUF model file
    n_ctx: Context window size
    n_gpu_layers: Number of layers to offload to GPU

Returns:
    Cached or newly created LlamaCppAIService instance

Parameters:

Name Type Default Description model_path? str | None None Path to the GGUF model file n_ctx? int 4096 Context window size n_gpu_layers? int 0 Number of layers to offload to GPU

Returns: "LlamaCppAIService" Cached or newly created LlamaCppAIService instance

docs.title: cleanup_llama_service
docs.text:
def cleanup_llama_service() -> None

:material-github: View source

Unload the cached LLM service to free memory.

Unload the cached LLM service to free memory.

Deletes the llama.cpp model from memory, clears the singleton cache,
and runs garbage collection. Frees ~4-5 GB for an 8B Q4 model.

Returns: None

docs.title: SQLiteDatabaseAdapter
docs.text:
:material-github: View source

SQLite implementation of the database adapter.

SQLite implementation of the database adapter.

Manages database connection, session lifecycle, and provides
access to all repositories.

Usage:
    adapter = SQLiteDatabaseAdapter("sqlite+aiosqlite:///./app.db")
    await adapter.initialize()

    async with adapter.session() as session:
        project = await adapter.projects.get("123")

    await adapter.close()

docs.title: MlxWhisperTranscriptionEngine
docs.text:
:material-github: View source

MLX Whisper-based transcription engine for Apple Silicon.

MLX Whisper-based transcription engine for Apple Silicon.

Uses lazy loading to avoid import errors when mlx-whisper is not installed.
Runs on MPS (Metal Performance Shaders) for GPU acceleration.

Important: This engine does NOT support speaker diarization.

Broadcast a data change notification to all connected clients.

Args:

    action: The action performed (e.g., 'created', 'updated', 'deleted', 'status_changed')
    id: Optional ID of the affected resource

docs.title: broadcast_job_progress :material-sync: async
docs.text:
async def broadcast_job_progress(

:material-github: View source

Broadcast job progress to all connected clients.

Args:
    job_id: The job ID
    job_type: The job type (e.g., 'summarize', 'transcribe', 'embed')
    status: The job status ('running', 'completed', 'failed')
    progress: Progress percentage (0-100)
    task_name: Human-readable task name
    recording_id: Optional associated recording ID
    transcript_id: Optional associated transcript ID
    error: Optional error message for failed jobs

docs.title: events.py
docs.text:
Lightweight async event bus for plugin integration.

Lightweight async event bus for plugin integration.

Core code emits events at key moments (transcription complete, document uploaded, etc.). Plugins subscribe to events in their register() method.

Usage: from core.events import on, emit, clear

async def my_handler(**kwargs):
    print(kwargs)

on("transcription.complete", my_handler)
await emit("transcription.complete", transcript_id="abc", recording_id="xyz")

docs.title: AdapterFactory
docs.text:
:material-github: View source

Factory for creating adapter instances based on tier configuration.

Factory for creating adapter instances based on tier configuration.

Usage:
    from core.config import settings
    from core.factory import AdapterFactory, AdapterConfig

    config = AdapterConfig(database_url=settings.DATABASE_URL)
    factory = AdapterFactory(settings.MODE, config)

    db = await factory.create_database_adapter()
    transcription = factory.create_transcription_engine()
    auth = factory.create_auth_provider()

docs.title: pyannote_catalog.py
docs.text:
Pyannote model catalog for speaker diarization.

Pyannote model catalog for speaker diarization.

Defines the pyannote models required for speaker diarization. The diarization pipeline (speaker-diarization-3.1) is a config-only repo that orchestrates two neural network sub-models: - pyannote/segmentation-3.0 (5.9 MB, gated) - pyannote/wespeaker-voxceleb-resnet34-LM (26.6 MB, public)

All gated models require a HuggingFace token with accepted license agreements. Downloads are managed explicitly — no auto-downloads at runtime.

docs.title: detect_available_devices
docs.text:
def detect_available_devices() -> list[str]

:material-github: View source

Detect available compute devices for transcription.

Detect available compute devices for transcription.

Returns devices based on available engines:
- cpu: Always available (WhisperX)
- cuda: Available if NVIDIA GPU + torch (WhisperX)
- mps: Available if Apple Silicon + mlx-whisper (MLX Whisper)

Result is cached.

Returns: list[str]

docs.title: detect_whisperx_device
docs.text:
def detect_whisperx_device() -> str

:material-github: View source

Detect the best device for WhisperX transcription.

Detect the best device for WhisperX transcription.

WhisperX (ctranslate2) supports cpu and cuda only.
Uses CTranslate2's native CUDA detection (independent of PyTorch CUDA).
MPS is handled by engine auto-detect selecting mlx-whisper instead.

Returns: str

Manages filesystem paths and operations for the filesystem-as-UI pattern.

Manages filesystem paths and operations for the filesystem-as-UI pattern.

Projects become folders, recordings/documents become files in those folders.
Files without a project live at the storage root.

docs.text:
Storage service for file management.

Storage service for file management.

Implements filesystem-as-UI pattern where: - Projects are folders on disk - Recordings/documents are files in those folders - Files without a project live at the storage root

Supports multiple storage backends through adapters (local, cloud, network).

Fetch the plugin manifest from /api/plugins/manifest.

Fetch the plugin manifest from /api/plugins/manifest. Returns the manifest data, or EMPTY_MANIFEST if no plugins are installed. Refetches on window focus (plugins may be installed/removed between sessions).

docs.title: keybindingStore.ts
docs.text:
Central keybinding store — single source of truth for all customizable shortcuts.

Central keybinding store — single source of truth for all customizable shortcuts. Uses Zustand with localStorage persistence. Only user overrides are stored; defaults are implicit and forward-compatible with new actions.
